column4: It seems that pure-ftp does require a valid shell to allow logins, any idea how to prevent this?
if you find out let me know proftpd shows the same behavior here
for proftpd I could disable it, but I had to switch to pure-ftp
disabling didnt work here
you can just edit /etc/proftpd/proftpd.conf and there set RequireValidShell no
ant then /etc/init.d/proftpd restart
thx tried that didnt work
mh that's unnormal, that worked for me ... but now I'm stuck with that damn pure-ftp
i found it unormal too maybe requiredvalidshell cancels out with chroot option? makes no sense i know but
nope, you can use that with chroot (I did so successfully)
maybe you've got the mysql module enabled, too and there you've got another requirevalidshell?
hmm i will have a look thanks for the hint
you can always Deny Some Group in your ssh conf and put all ftp user in that group
thats not what you wanted but thats what i do
cause its a server and ssh is the only way to access it anyway
thank you, that's a great idea
you can do the same a little bit mor complicated in PAM so it works for local login shells too but as i seed no need here
that's true, no need for that ... oh but maybe a technician tries to login locally ;-) Thanks for your tip
a technician locally has definitly no need for some ftp normal user shell i think ;)
but if you have a ftp server at home and do want your brother to use your computer
that's true :) I will just disable them in sshd_config. Thank you, I'd never have come to that idea :)
easy but very good and efficient, ty
you are welcome glad we could help each other
